subject: Negotiation
title: Consumer vs. Corporation
description: A short lesson to help you apply Consumer vs. Corporation.

hook.text: You call to cancel your subscription. Suddenly they offer you a deal they never mentioned before. That's leverage.

buildup.text: Corporations spend $300â€“$500 acquiring each customer. Losing one is expensive; retention teams know this.

discovery.text: The threat of leaving â€” cancellation, bad reviews, or switching â€” gives individual consumers real power.

twist.text: Companies train retention specialists to keep you. The best deals are reserved for people about to leave.

climax.text: Be polite but firm about leaving. The retention offer is almost always better than the standard price.

punchline.text: The best deal is often behind the 'cancel' button.

quiz.question: Why do companies offer better deals when you try to cancel?
options: Customer acquisition is expensive, so retaining you is cheaper than replacing you
